answers.answer: From my understanding, generally NST is used that early when you or baby may be a higher risk. I have been getting them since 32 weeks twice a week, and will continue until I deliver. I have a genetic connective tissue disorder that gives me a slightly higher risk of premature labor and rupture of membranes. All an NST consists of is you being hooked up to a contraction monitor for at least fifteen minutes. It stands for non stress test. It measures any contractions you may be having, baby's heart rate and baby's movements. They give you a button to push every time you feel baby move. Its a cake walk. Good luck.
They hook you up to the monitors (like at the hospital) and monitor babies movement... its usually for 1 hr every week. .. I wonder if I will have to start doing that too...
I have diabetes. May be that is why they want to do that

question: My doctor wants to do NST from 32 wks. Is it normal? How do they do it?
title: NST from 32 wk
